poem:
### Arrest on the Edge of Inquiry

In Nottingham's square, the echoes dance,  
a clasp of iron on uncertain words.  
Despine's voice a fluttered leaf,  
caught in the grasp of law's heavy hand.  

Innocence shivers under the cold lens,  
while questions linger, unasked, unheard—  
a silent protest on the winds of justice.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Protester’s arrest for alleged antisemitic chanting in Nottingham ruled unlawful Police acted in an “oppressive and unconstitutional manner” by arresting and detaining a protester for antisemitic chanting without making any inquiries as to what they allegedly said, a judge has found. Despine Green, who was 22 at the time, was handcuffed, photographed, fingerprinted, had a DNA swab taken from the inside of their cheek and an officer mentioned that a strip search might be necessary.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Protester’s arrest for alleged antisemitic chanting in Nottingham ruled unlawful Police acted in an “oppressive and unconstitutional manner” by arresting and detaining a protester for antisemitic chanting without making any inquiries as to what they allegedly said, a judge has found. Despine Green, who was 22 at the time, was handcuffed, photographed, fingerprinted, had a DNA swab taken from the inside of their cheek and an officer mentioned that a strip search might be necessary.
